website_summaries.verdict: May be overkill for one user, but excels as a work-group printer that churns out high-quality, full-color prints with ease.
pros: Large toner cartridge allows for almost double the number of black-and-white pages printed compared to smaller printers
Easy to connect to wireless feature
Photo-quality setting turns out crisp, rich images
cons: Some features, like scan to email, are hard to set up

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer. I did a lot of research trying to find a color laser printer to mostly replace inkjet printing. I was looking for something that had good consumable costs, printed quality text and graphics, and could do photos reasonably well when I didn't need perfect photo quality. This hit all the marks. Have also found it is fast, and lots of good features. Software support is excellent as well (for a Mac). This is my daily goto printer now.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Issacson

customer_reviews.title: Loses Itself From Network Repeatedly
customer_reviews.text: It constantly loses itself and is inconsistently available. Called Canon and their solution was to wipe my main computer because the software wouldn't reinstall. Was forced to manually add driver. Switched over to different computer (Mac this time) and it setup and worked... then would proceed to lose itself from network. The computer just loses itself from time to time for no reason. Very frustrated with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better hope you never get a paper jam!
customer_reviews.text: I have probably printed maybe 20 sheets of paper through this. I printed something on some semi-heavy paper and it jammed. No big deal I thought. I had 5 sheets of this paper in the unit. 2 had printed, I pulled out the jammed one and counted, yes I have 5 sheets here. Printer still says it's jammed. Was told to leave printer unplugged for 20 mins. No dice. One jam and the printer is bricked. Can't do anything at all with it now because it still thinks it's jammed. What a total piece of garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob C.

customer_reviews.title: Select correct Paper Type & Weight to get the best print results!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: With the right settings for paper type and weight, this is the best printer I have ever owned. I used to print photographs on wide format Epson Inkjet printers, but this printer beats the quality. In terms of functionality, it beats my HP printers with easy scan to PC feature. Scanner function is no match to studio quality Epson V750 Pro scanner, but it is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Davydov

customer_reviews.title: Super Eazzzy Setup and quick
customer_reviews.text: Just got this printer. Weighs a ton...but no complaints. Heavy duty is a plus. (recommend to have someone help lift this beast) Some electronics require you to work for NASA to set up, but this unit was super easy to set up in less than 10 min (coffee break included). Just follow the directions and you are good to go. First thoughts is that it prints very quickly. Black and white copies/print out was 3-5 seconds. Color was about 10 sec to print the first page. My other inkjet printer took 10 minutes to print out the first page...ugh.. Giving 4 stars for now until I put some miles on this machine and will update in full then.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Cannons bad warranty service!
customer_reviews.text: Not happy got new printer image class 733 And blue toner was leaving lines on the paper after contacting cannon they told me to buy new toner cartridge! After requesting Supervisor he confirmed that they were not going to help me out so I got a hold of Amazon and like always they were great but I would not buy another Cannon product
customer_reviews.author: Tank

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer although even Canon Customer Support is pissed at ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer although even Canon Customer Support is pissed at Canon for not bundling the scan software in a more user friendly manner. Plan to just give up and spend an hour on hold to talk to a support agent to walk you through an advanced downlaod/setup process. Otherwise, I absolutely love love love this printer, and wish I'd thrown my old ones away long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Canon Color imageCLASS MF733Cdwm - Fantastic product. Recommend purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a color printer with multi-features, easy to use. I wanted a change from the inkjet/deskjet printer. I grew tired of the tiny ink cartridges and running out of ink quickly. The Canon imageClass, model MF733cdwm is an excellent printer. I am very pleased with the performance of the laser printer. The initial setup was slightly challenging but overall not bad. A family member help figure it out; it was a simple task for that person. I would recommend purchasing this printer. It prints card stock as well. The laser ink cartridges cost about $98 for 4 cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Best printer I've ever had. I got tired of the expensive ink cartridges for the ink jet printer. The cost of replacing the ink 3 times on my HP Ink jet was more than this printer. I've already printed over 1000 pages and it has hardly put a dent in the toner. Color is perfect. I love the wireless printing feature. Works great every time.
customer_reviews.author: WarrenK

customer_reviews.title: Auto Document Feeder Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Canon ImageClass MF733Cdw in August. The unit took forever to make copies. Then the document feeder broke in November. I got a replacement unit today (probably refurbished) and that document feeder also does not work. Not sure what to do as Canon won't refund money, but wants to ship a third unit. Crazy. I would highly discourage you from buying this product (even with the new discounts). I think there may be an overall problem with the design.
customer_reviews.author: David in Chevy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product with a little disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great machine and I am very impressed. This is my third Canon printer in 10 years and their US based customer service team can't be beat. My disappointment comes from the scanner software they used. They opted for a cheap software this time around with minimal editing capabilities. My other all-in ones had more editing capabilities at less then half the cost of this machine. Next time I buy I may look elsewhere due to them saving $30.00.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Wald

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, scanner, copier, fax!
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaced our HP M477fnw, which had developed issues. The Canon MF733Cdw is fantastic. It works SO MUCH better and faster with my MAC. The HP worked ok with windows, but very slow with the MAC. This Canon has much more memory, and is just much faster when there is a lot of data or graphics. Prints well, crisp, clean. easy to manage & control. Happy for the desktop scanner software.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent print quality and fast.
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a need to use tech support so i have not rated that review attribute. Great printer for the price. Photos are so much better than my inkjet. I upgraded because i needed new printheads and new ink carts which would have totaled approx 300. Wifi connection excellent, easy setup. The only thing i would improve on is that the front door to access cartridges is a bit flimsy but would not affect decision to buy. Excellent product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Grilli

customer_reviews.title: Had some difficulty setting up initially but now it’s great
customer_reviews.text: All in all I really like this printer. It took me quite awhile to get it set up in my home office and get it to connect to both of my computers. I had to call tech support in the end after I had tried everything but they were extremely helpful in helping me get it set up. The instruction manual sucks FYI. Thus why I had to call tech support. Print quality is great. The toner is super expensive but they’re quality prints so I can’t complain.
customer_reviews.author: CDH

customer_reviews.title: Ok for smaller jobs - but not big ones
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these printers in our office. They are great for small print jobs - but very slow for larger print jobs. When we print 10 copies of duplex color documents with 20 or more pages, the printing starts out fast in the first document, but then slows to a crawl (several seconds per page) after that. We have this printer installed in two separate offices on two separate networks/computers and it does the same in both offices. We even tried to switch from WiFi to wired and it makes no difference. If you need a printer for large print jobs, then I suggest you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Prints great - touch screen is a hassle!
customer_reviews.text: The print quality is great. However the touch screen is not as sensitive as we would like it in our small business. You have to hold your finder on the item for selection for a bit. And sometimes it still doesn't take. I called support. They were very nice and helpful but didn't really have an answer for me to "fix" the issue. Just to hold my finger longer or use a pencil eraser. Not even a stylus.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Babcock

customer_reviews.title: <20 pages into it, prints in SOLID PINK - whole page. Ear-piercing screeching noise.
customer_reviews.text: Made an ear-piercing screeching noise - and my ears still hurt - and then printed pages in SOLID PINK TONER. BOTH SIDES. I sent a document to be printed - multiple copies. The first one came out normal - text on a white paper. Then the subsequent pages ANNIHILATED my toner by printing in SOLID PINK. If listening to ear-piercing screeches and having pages worth of SOLID PINK toner is your kind of thing, definitely buy this printer. Waiting on Canon for support. This was all after <20 pages printed total. Worst printer I've ever, ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Erratic Connection Issues - Do Not Recomend
customer_reviews.text: This printer constantly looses the ability to print from multiple devices (phones, computers, tablets) for unknown reasons. It is not my network setup as I have used multiple routers and it is connected via cat5 not wireless.. This printer is extremely frustrating! Kids and wife constantly complaining they can't print. A reboot of the printer typically works. I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: IMright

customer_reviews.title: Everything needed/wanted
customer_reviews.text: Easy Setup. Works with Windows 7, 10, 2012r2 and Mac No network or configuration issues - Stays connected (I have professional WAPs though) Works every time. Powers up, prints and goes to sleep. Yes it make take 10 secs - big whoop Color laser w/duplex printing People complain color toner is expensive, well then get a black/white printer or if you want real cheap, they still make dot matrix printers. Toner is not cheap. That should have been part of your research for TCO.
customer_reviews.author: GJW

customer_reviews.title: Fast and quiet!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this machine for my wife's tax office. Main reason for selecting this is 2 sided scanning and printing, and the Automatic Document Feeder. Set up was fairly easy, except initially connecting to the wireless network. I called Support, and was connected to a real person within 2 minutes! The issue was the network I was trying to connect to was 5g, and the printer is 2.4g. Made the changes, and everything went well! Still learning everything, but very pleased this far.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Denny

customer_reviews.title: My $59 epson does a better job
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been a pain in the tushie from day 1. The scan color was way off, called tech support and trouble shot forever. Later figured out a way to solve the problem on my own, which was a super easy fix, I just needed to know about it (apparently the tech was as clueless as I was). It eats the paper as it feeds to scan, and often grabs multiple pages at once. I literally have to stand there and watch as it feeds each page because I have sent things to clients with missing pages due to the problem. Not a time saver to babysit a printer. I would never buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy H

customer_reviews.title: Great laser printer for the price and build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great printer, high quality prints and scans. Expensive toner but it lasts a long time. Make sure to always print black & white to make toners last else it will use a blend of colrs to print in black. Works superb with google cloud print.
customer_reviews.author: Odie

customer_reviews.title: Seriously . . . . don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: This printer is terrible. The wireless works about 10% of the time. I have to re-start my computer and the printer each about 3 times before they recognize each other - EVERY SINGLE TIME I WANT TO PRINT SOMETHING. You can save settings in the Remote UI app, that usually also doesn't recognize or communicate with actual printer. Scanning - well, it's worked once. But even after working before, and directly after printing from the computer, it will have a message that there's no computer to scan to. Once it actually does print, the quality/speed/sound is good. But definitely not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole A LaMar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer and other ‘multi-function’ uses!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t review the tech support because I didn’t need to call them! This printer / copier / fax / scanner, is easy to use, easy to set up and connections were all simple to do. The quality of the printing is excellent and have only replaced the cartridges once in six months. I prepare tax returns and print them using this printer, it’s very professional print jobs and the printer performs like a champ! It’s also easy print from my cell phone or any WiFi connected technology. It’s an “air printer” on my apple phone and I’ve had absolutely NO PROBLEMS out of it. Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: seems to work great and fast printing from sleep mode
customer_reviews.text: a little tricky to set up for bw only printing to save color ink. I came from a dell 1675 printer that has big ink cartridges which I now have too many of after it quit. I think the fuser gave up. It was low volume as will be this one so only time will tell on quality but canon has always been good. I repaired some of the 90 canon color copiers at kinkos and other larger companies and they always ran great if the paper quality was good. this is a few months down the road and on the second ream of paper and still great performance.
customer_reviews.author: charliew

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS PRINTER RIGHT NOW
customer_reviews.text: I bought and returned FOUR printers before finally buying this one. Its simply amazing. High quality prints, works well on cardstock, auto duplexes, is network shareable does two sided scanning and so much more! Just go ahead and buy it, there is nothing out there even remotely comparable
customer_reviews.author: jaime

customer_reviews.title: No Regrets!
customer_reviews.text: Tired of the high toner costs esp. for infrequent home printing from my HP inkjet printer. Bought this instead on Oct 2017. It's Sep 2020, never had a jam, still working with the original sample ink that came with it. Only had to call the Support once because I have forgotten my admin password, which is an optional setting. And it's super easy and they make the experience effortless. If you're looking for a printer, reject inkjet's scamming practice and buy a Canon laser printer instead.
customer_reviews.author: xMilitary

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: It slows down DRASTICALLY after printing the first 30 pages of a job. Constantly jamming. Numerous problems with print smears and marks. Spoken to tech support multiple times and they blame it on my PC but then when I point out that it doesn't happen with other printers when printing from the same PC then they agree it is indeed the printer's fault. Now it's just sitting in the middle of a print job with the status "Waiting" BUT WAITING FOR WHAT? WHY IS THIS POS NOT PRINTING? IT'S BEEN ONE BIG HEADACHE EVER SINCE I GOT IT. I CAN ONLY HOPE THAT CANON WILL HONOR THEIR WARRANTY ON THIS GARBAGE
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: I like the printer very much
customer_reviews.text: I like the printer very much. The only reason I didn’t give it five stars is because it is very difficult to learn to operate. The fact that there is no included Manual, means that you have to download it or printed out. It is over 700 pages long! Having said all that the folks at Cannon provide free and quite excellent technical assistance over the phone . I had to call them several times to get everything working the way it should. Every time they were very helpful and quite friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Printer for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This printer will really enhance your home office. We don't do a lot of printing, but this replacement of our previous Canon B&W unit really impressed me. The image quality is really good, especially color photos. Used it for our annual Christmas letter and it cranked out 30 high quality front-to-back copies complete with color photos in about three or four minutes. It's quiet, easy to set up, and scans and copies much easier than our older printer. Aftermarket ink isn't horrendously expensive ($60 - $70 for three color and one black cartridges). Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ferris Bueller

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality of Print!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great regarding print quality and many printer features. The downside of it is how SLOW it performs between pressing print on the computer and getting a finished copy...it takes forever! Once I got used to doing other things while waiting for the printed page, it was okay. However, I feel a printer shouldn't be so slow. The ink prices are good and LAST well past the out of ink light. It is NOT an ink guzzler like some of the HP's I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm

customer_reviews.title: You cannot disable sleep mode and that’s a problem
customer_reviews.text: Great unit EXCEPT that you cannot disable sleep mode. Once sleeping, it takes a very long time for the unit to wake up so you can print to it from a mobile device (no printers show up for about 30 seconds). Ridiculous that you can’t change this OR have the printer react faster to network traffic.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: nice laser printer, just toner is too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer, works fine on my small business. wireless setting in not easy, however Canon phone support is excelant (it is main reason I kept on buying Canon) canon tonner only last few months, Canon toner full set (3 color and one black) is almost printer price I used 3rd party toners, it made leaking and makes lines on the print so I have to replace them over half full.
customer_reviews.author: Young Park

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all cost
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible printer. Multiple calls into Canon service and it still drops off the network all the time. In addition, the scan and send to email does not work at all. The multiple vids online showing a “fix” back in 2017 no longer work. I updated to the latest firmware to no avail. To add insult to injury, the printer is huge and the box it comes in basically falls apart when opened. Convenient but good luck returning...
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! Lots of nice features!
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer! Great for a small home office. I don't print a lot quantity wise, but do print shipping labels and flyers often. The auto duplex feature works great and is super fast. Also the double sided scanning saves time and frustration. I haven't used all the features yet, but so far everything works. The only problem I've had is it occasionally makes random noise like it is starting up from sleep mode and I haven't been able to find out why. I haven't had to refill toner yet, so hopefully that won't be a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: B. Goodman

customer_reviews.title: So far....so good!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted not just to buy another good printer, but one more versatile. Packaging was solid. Everything was taped and protected with no damage to the unit. The toner was all in place inside of the unit and there was no need to "pull tabs or strips" to set them up. Has a NFC tab to the right making setting up with my Samsung 9 a breeze. Had to install two apps, but that was simple. Printed two documents and a photo, and each were streak/line/smear free. So far, the printer is great!
customer_reviews.author: fos

customer_reviews.title: so far so great, but installing and configuring was not that easy
customer_reviews.text: Setting up and configuring was not as straight forward as I would have liked. You have to install the drivers and software to fully utilize the features such as scan to computer, and wireless print. It is a bit large and heavy but overall, I think the print quality and scanning abilities are great. The double sided scanning & printing as well as large capacity ink cartridges are my favorite features. A lot of high-end features at a good price
customer_reviews.author: Edward C.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Really like this printer. All the printer cartridges are already included and set up inside. No fumbling with individual unpacking. Protective packaging is very good. Easy to set up and calibrates well. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: not inquisitive in its set up
customer_reviews.text: not easy to change settings and also it takes it a while to print when you push the button, which makes you push again thinking it didn't register the first time, so you end up with more prints than necessary. great on ink savings but frustrating at times.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this printer
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from HP all in one because Color imageCLASS MF733Cdw is a laser color all in one. However, this printer is not reliable. I always had wifi connection problems. I am tired of reinstalling the software and drivers. When you try to print or scan, it is extremely slow and there is always a connection issue. I never experienced such issues with HP. The print quality is OK but Canon software and connection problems are killing me!!
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Quick double sided auto feed scanning, fast printing, low toner usage
customer_reviews.text: Super nice. used in my home office. 1. Scans really quick including fast autofeed (downside for HP ones from reviews) 2. Double sided, one pass scanning using autofeeder - what a charm 3. Short time from pressing PRINT button to starting to print (Inkjet ones need to ponder, meditate, analyse, and hesitate before willing to start) 4. Can put in A4 paper both in the drawer or Multipurpose Tray 5. Quite economical in toner usage. after quite some use for 3 months, black only used 25%, color 15% Downside: boy it's heavy. Only need to set up once though. Glad I don't need to carry it to work...
customer_reviews.author: Dave Lam

customer_reviews.title: Canon has ruined me from considering another brand!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent b&w and color print quality. -Super fast print speed. -Feeds any paper, even light economy paper. -Quick scanning. -Easy WiFi and USB connectiviy. -Toner cartridges last a long time if in a moderately active home office. Would like to see this printer offered in black. More intuitive user software would be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Phantom Server

customer_reviews.title: When the ink is used up I'll just buy another printer.
customer_reviews.text: To replace all 4 color toner cartridges costs more money than just buying a new printer that comes with them. Things are getting stupid. Printer is excellent and the inks do last a long time. I estimate the printer and it's inks will last 2 years with normal use at home. After that I'll just buy a replacement printer that comes with inks and put this one on the curb. IDIOTIC.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Had a few issues originally with printing due to paper settings, but now it seems to work well now. I had to powerdown and reboot but its awesome so far. Had a monochrome Canon imgageclass before and now updated to the color and have no regrets! Trusted brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rox M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer and Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely happy with this printer. I have it connected wireless and it works without any issues. The printing quality is very good and the scanner is excellent, especially the dual sided, single pass auto feeder. It is much bigger than I was anticipating, so be sure you check the measurements for where you are going to put it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B. Husted

customer_reviews.title: Canon MF733Cdw
customer_reviews.text: This printer is adequate, but really isn't much of a work horse. If you plan to use it for business, you should look into a different brand. I've also been disappointed with the speed. It prints very slowly! And forget about printing on card stock. It doesn't work at all! I wish I would have exchanged it for something I like better, but I've had such a terrible experience with delivery and getting the correct model. They originally sent me a used printer that was the wrong model and I've also tried an HP printer that was worse than this. I'm having a terrible time finding a decent printer!
customer_reviews.author: C Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great AIO for personal/home office use
customer_reviews.text: I use this AIO in my home office and have been thoroughly satisfied with its speed and print quality. The auto-duplex printing helps me save paper and its ability to scan both sides of a document in a single pass saves me time. The unit has yet to jam on me. Since the printer is connected to my network, everyone can easily use it. While I haven’t tested the NFC and wifi direct connection printing options, I have used it via AirPrint without issues. The 5-inch touch panel is surprisingly responsive. My only complaint: OCR scanning is not available for macOS users out of the box. Instead, third-party software is required.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Great General business printer love the duplex.
customer_reviews.text: This is used remain office copier and printer for Color we use a huge copier for major black and white stuff but this thing works great for color stuff. The duplex feature on both scanning and copying is great. We're IT people and this is one of the best devices for my customers the only gripe is setting up scanning and email is not straightforward therefore I took off one star.
customer_reviews.author: chspyder

customer_reviews.title: NEVER BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Error code 078-0000 never go away. Called Canon several times but no one comes on the line even after waiting for several minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Ramesh Cherivirala

customer_reviews.title: Really Bad Experience with this Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for a year and a half. It has been a problem since the beginning. I bought it to replace a color ink jet. The color has never been consistent. It is really horrible when printing photographs. And now, it keeps printing multiple red streaks across every document. I've cleaned it, followed all the tech instructions, etc... and it won't go away. I'm now using an old Samsung printer I had stored in my closet because it works way better than this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Barry L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to replace an HP which when doing the calculation on a print per page you save more money then DeskJet. Print quality is not bad, and scan quality is excellent. I have used this printer since December and has done its job. I am disappointed on how it can be slow to connect onto the wifi to do direct scans to my laptop. Scanning does jam from time to time, but it is an easy fix. One of the pluses of this printer is the warranty. Hp and other companies charge extra.
customer_reviews.author: P Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Nice All-In-One, But Scanner Functionality Is Lacking A Little
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this machine meets my expectations, but the scanner functionality is lacking a little. Had to reload the software to get it to work on the 2nd use, and I can only scan to my computer using the scanner utility on the PC, not from the printer display screen (using USB connection). This scanner issue is just a little irritating and not a show stopper by any means.
customer_reviews.author: GM212

customer_reviews.title: Can’t miss with this laser prtr.
customer_reviews.text: Made an Excellent choice. Kept hesitating whether to order a laser ptr or another ink cartridge ptr. Took the plunge. Great a.i.o. Machine. The print quality is superb. Any color printing has been exceptional. Even though it isn’t recommended for higher quality photo printing it still does a very acceptable photo print. Easy as pie to set up. Needed nothing more than quick guide instructions. Tweaked settings for printing, copying, faxing etc.
customer_reviews.author: Paddy

customer_reviews.title: So Far A Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Having had a Brother Laser that I just found not stand, this Canon is a welcome addition to my office. Everything about it is fine. It just works great. Wireless or wired, always connects. The brother constantly lost connection. Had several HP's but thought I'd try this one and I'm GLAD I did.
customer_reviews.author: Asinow

customer_reviews.title: Beyond a piece of garbage and the professional installation was equally as bad
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this all-in-one and planned to purchase another one. I even paid for professional installation. While the tech installed the printer, he could not get the scanner to work even though he downloaded the drivers. I run Windows 10. Not difficult. He said I needed to call customer service. No, I paid for professional installation and I could have done what he did. I will never purchase a Canon product again and will be seeking a refund for both.
customer_reviews.author: Lawyerboy7

customer_reviews.title: UI very poor and accepts only USB2.0 sticks
customer_reviews.text: After spending several hours trying to get my 'scan to email' feature working, I discovered that it was converting the underscore in my email address to a period. Couldn't get around it so scan to email was not an option for me. To top it off, the ability to print from USB relies on the old USB2.0 memory sticks. Any USB3.0 memory stick shows up as 'not supported'. The user interface on the web tool (with the fancy name of Remote UI) is very complicated and non-intuitive. Personally, I am returning the item. Too bad because the build quality is solid and the other reviews I saw were positive. Thank goodness for Amazon and their easy return process!
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: GATHERING DUST
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get this thing to work wirelessly with any consistency; certainly not wired and wireless (not even possible)? I think I'm fairly tech savvy, but cannot make heads or tails of this thing. The buttons to make it work on the screen are awful, the software mostly can't be found on my PC. It's been SO frustrating. I think I've had it over a year now and barely used it for a pretty good chunk of change. I have a beautiful Canon printer at work so thought it would be a good idea at home. I'd love to have someone from support contact me to sort it out if you're listening???
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The copies are wonderful and the Archon replacement cartridges work great. Toner is now affordable and still great quality. Some say the Archon yellow is off a little but when you look at the copy without a comparison you can not tell. If you want to do photos they will be acceptable. For photos, I recommend and Epson ink printer.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Mueller

customer_reviews.title: A Very Decent Printer with Very Expensive Ink Set
customer_reviews.text: Prints images the way Canon always does, and very sharp texts, too. The problem is the long term operation of the printer that involves probably the most expensive set of inks in the market today. I don't know if this business model works in the long run, but people will most likely try alternative inks that will be developed for this model and brand. When that happens, as indeed it has already happened, everybody loses because the printer owner will have bad quality prints and less sales for Canon. Quality can never really sustain itself in a system that encourages substantial markups and programmed obsolescene. More industrial wastes to export abroad. ;-(
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Enero

customer_reviews.title: Nice Printer
customer_reviews.text: We find the printer to be great for our needs. Two disappointments.... it will not scan to a computer on our network, or at least we have been unsuccessful in doing so, and it often will not come awake when a network computer sends it data.. Otherwise it is a great machine and has been trouble free.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Harman

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Linux
customer_reviews.text: Scans to a FTP on my Linux machine, and my Linux machine can print to this in color, duplex, with tray and media selection no trouble at all. Nice upgrade from the mono MFP Printer I had previously. It does take up quite a bit of space on the desk so you will need a bit of room for it. After market toner is very reasonably priced for this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hepler

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Before this printer, I had an HP that I loved; however, I was printing so much it was going out of ink quickly and I was using way over the max on the HP Instant Ink plan which means I was paying alot out of pocket. This printer is so crisp and clear and I love the colors! Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sims

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer, software could be better
customer_reviews.text: This machine is an excellent printer, and an excellent scanner. The quality of both black and color prints is extremely good. Color accuracy is good and the detail in the output is very crisp. The scanner is also very fast, particularly with duplex scanning. The ability to scan to email comes in very handy. Canon driver software is a pain, however. It was difficult to install, particularly on managed workstations. Once you're able to get through the software hurdles, it works flawlessly and reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Alex P

customer_reviews.title: The Printer Works Great - Ignore Bad Reviews From Old People Who Don't Know How to Use a Computer
customer_reviews.text: I rarely do reviews, but I felt like I needed to bump up the avg stars on this printer. When searching for a laser printer I noticed there weren't any "slam-dunk" options with close to five stars. After reading a good chunk of the bad reviews I realized that they were mostly due to technological incompetence...so if you aren't daunted by maybe having to troubleshoot something or go to Canon's website to download a scan utility or drivers then this is a great printer for you. It's connected to all my computers via wifi, scanning items works great, the print quality is wonderful. Best printer I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: stephen taubel

customer_reviews.title: The more I use it the better I like it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this several months now and the more I use it the better I like it
customer_reviews.author: Gofast

customer_reviews.title: Dream Multi-function Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best value for home users who want a color laser printer that can double for doing copies, faxes etc. There was virtually no setup effort out of the box. Without fuss we were able to print from our iPhone across our home network. And the machine is pretty quiet too. I literally spent months researching products, and it doesn't get any better than this for a home office. .
customer_reviews.author: David M. Golden

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer
customer_reviews.text: Ok.. the printer itself prints fine (when you can connect to it). The drivers are AWFUL.. the new ones will not work. You have to get the older ones. If you have installed it once, and want to delete and start again.. you cannot. Canon drivers do not uninstall properly. You have to go deep into the registry to uninstall them. If you want to FDR the printer for any reason. There is no documentation out there that will tell you how. You HAVE to call them to get the instructions. Like I said the printer works fine... IF you can connect to it.
customer_reviews.author: Sefent

customer_reviews.title: So far it’s good, hope work more longer than inkjet
customer_reviews.text: first time got the laser printer, I also bought Canon products for the first time. At first, I did not find the CD, so the system I downloaded from the Internet was very poor. I could not use sanner at all and almost ready to return it. Lucky l found the installation CD,So far it seems to be working good, except that the touchscreen desktop is not as responsive as it needs to be. Anyway, expect a longer life than an inkjet printer
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy and huge. Still, once we get it set up on its stand, it was easy-pease after that! Easy to set up. Easiest ever to get to print. No downloading or fussing, just click and print. Print from a Mac, Lenovo, Viao, even our phones. Nice quality print in color and B&W.
customer_reviews.author: Mala

customer_reviews.title: Fast but not up to date with current technology
customer_reviews.text: Better design, fast printing but needs a lot of improvement 1. Not easy to install 2. Can not come with a wire that connects it with computer 3. Cool WiFi printing feature but can not print from remote places 4. Not really compatible with iMAc I may return it soon as it does not serve the purpose
customer_reviews.author: Vishwas J. Patel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to try the printer based on some of the reviews but decided to give it a try. Everything was flawless and setup was fast and easy. I’m so glad we went with this printer and have had zero issues with all the devices we’ve connected.
customer_reviews.author: R.J.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but insists on new cartriges too early.
customer_reviews.text: I used the cartridges that came with this printer for 9 months after it started pestering me (message on my screen) to buy more. But, prints great and a monkey could change the cartridges. I bought knock off cartridges BTW that work as good as the Canon cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S. Luenser

customer_reviews.title: Worst copier ever...
customer_reviews.text: This unit is not good at all, after I changed the toner I have black lines on the left side of the paper. I have tried to call customer service and waiting on hold for over 30 minutes 2 times. There is no technical live chat available. No way to send an email. It's like as soon as you buy the unit you are abandoned... Never buying a Canon product again !!!
customer_reviews.author: hughesla50

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect to computer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is terrible. It will connect to wifi, but won't pop up on the printer list no matter what I try. I've deleted and reinstalled drivers, reset everything to factory specs, reset the mac printing system, etc. Nothing works. This is the second Canon printer I've had that failed in only a few months - and the warranty process is terrible. Avoid this printer at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Archie D.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding printer!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works everytime, wired or wireless. Great color and font type configuration. Unlike the miserable inkjet fiasco printer which require nozzle cleaning and alignment after sitting a while. This printer completes the job pronto. Yes a higher price, but the difference in performance is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Thos. Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: ... a little more complicated to me but color is fantastic as always with a canon
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from an older canon - not sure about the touchscreen yet - takes some getting used to- scan is different from my previous canon to a desktop - software seems a little more complicated to me but color is fantastic as always with a canon machine
customer_reviews.author: Christine Stebbins

customer_reviews.title: Canon, what can I say?
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Printer. HEAVY like a train but an awesome addition to our office. CON: The menu and manual are not too user-friendly, esp in the area of IT. HINT: Use the 'Web Page' to set-up, the 'user' screen sucks! PRO: Would recommend and buy again if need be.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install, Great Copy/printing
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to install and use almost immediately. It came with toner already in it, and printed perfectly. The page that I copied, you couldn't tell which one was the original and which one was the copy. I am very impressed with this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Moving away from Canon after this printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer started ok, doing basic text pages and scanning. Scanning is actually a problem because it doesn't always connect to the computer via the wireless network. Then the smudges started appearing on my pages, and now it only prints completely smudged documents. There is, very handily, NO cleaning function in either embedded printer UI or the computer software....pretty useful, huh? Going to have to replace this very expensive and barely-a-year-old printer with another , probably from Brother.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherL805

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye ink... hello laser
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier with this printer. I was so frustrated with ink printers. Finally went with laser, and so happy I did. The printer takes generic toner without putting up a fight, and prints are clear and vivid.
customer_reviews.author: Clearwater

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing
customer_reviews.text: it's like having my office only at home. It does any paper related job I throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: H. Roark

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: After less than a year the document feeder doesn't work and neither does the scanner. What a ripoff!
customer_reviews.author: Gordon L. Hasty

customer_reviews.title: Must use Mopria print app to mobile print from your smartphone
customer_reviews.text: Fast, clear printing. Easy to set up. Cust svc was astonishingly easy to get ahold of. I couldn't figure out how to pair with my smartphone to print files. Mopria app on the play store is what they recommended. Easy to install and set up. Bought this printer for my office, will he getting another for home.
customer_reviews.author: EP

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for brochures and labels
customer_reviews.text: Great Printer. It Prince low resolution pictures very well on brochure paper. It also handles heavy label and brochure paper without any special settings.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa B.

customer_reviews.title: Jury is out on its reliability and value
customer_reviews.text: This is very temperamental with regard to the wireless connection to my computer and I've had to delete it and reinstall it a couple of times. Ugh. But, it makes nice prints. The copies are not great unless you change the settings to darker ink colors. Not sure I'd buy it again - the jury is out.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Love the wireless full duplex printing
customer_reviews.text: This printer works great- color laser, on both sides (full duplex). Love the ability to air print. The menu could be better and this thing his huge. Every now and then I have to turn it off/on for it to be recognized, hence the one star removal.
customer_reviews.author: MDickson17

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful printer
customer_reviews.text: First thing I'd like to note, the thing is heavy, read the unpacking directions to save yourself a lot of trouble. The quality is way better than what I was getting with my hp printer. It's quiet, quick and easy to use. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: Jairtzinio O.

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for the money. Reccomend over any ink jet for printing paper.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Wish something were easier to set you such as scan to email. But printing, coping and scaning work great. Its efficient and the toner it comes with last a long time (going on 1700 pages). Would recommend over any ink jet for printing on paper.
customer_reviews.author: Devon D.

customer_reviews.title: I now have two!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first printer a year ago and when we needed to add another, I didn't hesitate to buy it again. I have a small office and this printer does everything we need it to do. I am very happy with the functions and all the features.
customer_reviews.author: BrentATL

customer_reviews.title: Wrong info on toner yield
customer_reviews.text: Printer works great, fast printing.! However, misleading information on how many sheets you can printed. It started displaying low toner only after 100+ sheets whereas the it should be printing 2000+ sheets as the description. After waiting for 30 mins on phone to connect to a customer rep, he mentioned numbers are based on 5% yield, that means assuming that print has only few lines per page..... really. So if you print full pages then expect to replace toner after every 200-300 pages print.
customer_reviews.author: CmaS

customer_reviews.title: quick great looking prints
customer_reviews.text: quick great looking prints. Beware though this printer is a beast!! Best for a small office. Your are going to want to use a printer cart or cabinet this is not going to fit on your desk.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Fite

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It's print is professional looking and it prints quickly, much quicker than I'm used to. I have not had to buy replacement cartridges yet. That might be the scary part of this. The printers are much cheaper than the cartridges. It almost easier to buy another printer than spend the money on cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia D. Simms

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding color laser for small business
customer_reviews.text: Superb resolution, very sturdy and well made, easy to set up. If you have a small / midsized business where you’re regularly producing small batches of glossy’s / semi-glossy’s, user manuals, focused printed marketing - this printer is an excellent choice. At 1200x1200 dpi it is plenty good to do small runs in-house.
customer_reviews.author: PeteInHouston

customer_reviews.title: Great B/W, Average Color Qualtiy, Software is pathetic...
customer_reviews.text: Headline says it all, I am on the third try to install the entire software suite (Printer/Fax/Scan) onto Windows 10. Maybe the third time will be the charm - not impressed so far. B/W printing is fast and high quality, color is fine but not as good as a less expensive inkjet.
customer_reviews.author: szd -seattle

customer_reviews.title: Great print in color that prints fast.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to set up. Use as family printer for all kinds of things from kids school projects, art work, reports, home office business letters, etc. Basically we print to it from everything laptops, desktop, iPhones, iPads surface tablets. Even though the initial color cartridges are smaller I am getting much better toner yields. My kids were going through ink jet cartridges like crazy on our older printer.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping, great product and seller. Excellent printer for our small business.
customer_reviews.author: F. Jones

customer_reviews.title: I didn't know I could hate a printer this much.  Good quality though?
customer_reviews.text: Network functionality has been horrific and the UI to fix it hasn't been the most helpful. I had to assign a static IP to it in order to print things.
customer_reviews.author: The David C

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer
customer_reviews.text: Sooo easy to use, i only use the app on my phone now..so simple..no more drying out ink cart's..print quality is not excellent , but good enought for my limited home use
customer_reviews.author: BISCUIT

customer_reviews.title: So great, but so big!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer really delivers on speed, like no other printer I've ever owned. And for that, I'd buy it over and over again. My only beef is it's massive size. Think mini-fridge big.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Russell

customer_reviews.title: Sweet....Tart
customer_reviews.text: Sweet: This printer is great. Tart: the ink is FREAKING crazy expensive! average $165 per color! BUT, the "off-brand" stuff is priced much much lower (and it works very well with the printer)
customer_reviews.author: William

product_meta.title: Canon Color imageCLASS MF733Cdw - All in One, Wireless, Duplex Laser Printer (Comes with 3 Year Limited Warranty), Amazon Dash Replenishment Ready
product_meta.description: The all-in-one, Canon Color image class MF733Cdw comes with a 3 Year Limited Warranty. Enjoy peace of mind with expert assistance for every level of experience and uncompromising dedication to product reliability, service and support. Your professional quality color documents are printed at speeds of up to 28 pages per minute in both color and black and white with a quick first print time of 9 seconds or less. Get high quality, crisp and bold color business documents as well as photos using V2 (Vivid and Vibrant) Color Technology, which increases image sharpness and color vibrancy. Eco-conscious, all-mode duplexing saves you time, paper, and related costs, as well as limits interruptions so you can print, scan, copy and fax with ease. The intuitive 5-inch color touch led panel allows you to navigate through the menu seamlessly. The MF733Cdw has wireless connectivity and Wi-Fi Direct Connection enables easy connection to mobile devices without a router. Pairing your mobile device just got easier - simply scan the qi Code function on the MF733Cdw using the Canon Print Business app to connect wirelessly. Print on-the-go using your compatible mobile device, such as Canon Print Business, Apple Air Print, Morea Print Service and Google Cloud Print. The MF733Cdw has neck capability, so you can simply "tap and print" using your compatible Android mobile device. The MF733Cdw provides generous, expandable paper capacity up to 850-sheets. The single-pass, duplex scan allows you to scans both sides of your document in a single pass through the duplex, automatic document feeder. High-capacity toner options keep you printing longer, with limited toner replacements so you can keep pace with your busy output needs. The MF733Cdw uses Canon Genuine Toner, Cartridge 046 (cry yields 2,300 sheets / K yields 2,200 sheets) and Cartridge 046 Hi Capacity cyma (cry yields 5,000 sheets / K yields 6,300 sheets). Low energy consumption; uses less than 1 W in Energy Saver Mode
feature_bullets: Easily connect your mobile devices without a router using Wi Fi Direct connection
Generous, expandable paper capacity allows for up to 850 sheets
Hi capacity toner options keep up with your printing needs and limit toner Replacement interruptions.Power Source: 120 V, 60Hz
Save 10% on all ink reorders with Dash Replenishment. Upon activation your printer measures ink levels and places smart reorders when you are running low. No subscription fees. Cancel anytime.
Includes 3 year limited warranty 100percentage U. S. Based service and support team provides friendly, expert help for every level of experience
Print at speeds of up to 28 pages per minute with your first print in your hands in 9 seconds or less. The memory capacity is upto 512 sheets and the paper output is 150 sheets (face down)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars489 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
